metadata.title: CVE-2014-0249 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) 1.11.6 does not properlyidentify group membership when a non-POSIX group is in a group membershipchain, which allows local users to bypass access restrictions viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0249` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 1.13.1-2
libnss-sss - 1.13.1-2
libpam-sss - 1.13.1-2
libsss-certmap0 - 1.13.1-2
libsss-idmap0 - 1.13.1-2
libsss-nss-idmap0 - 1.13.1-2
libsss-simpleifp0 - 1.13.1-2
libsss-sudo - 1.13.1-2
libwbclient-sssd - 1.13.1-2
python-libipa-hbac - 1.13.1-2
python-libsss-nss-idmap - 1.13.1-2
python-sss - 1.13.1-2
python3-libipa-hbac - 1.13.1-2
python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 1.13.1-2
python3-sss - 1.13.1-2
sssd - 1.13.1-2
sssd-ad - 1.13.1-2
sssd-ad-common - 1.13.1-2
sssd-common - 1.13.1-2
sssd-dbus - 1.13.1-2
sssd-ipa - 1.13.1-2
sssd-kcm - 1.13.1-2
sssd-krb5 - 1.13.1-2
sssd-krb5-common - 1.13.1-2
sssd-ldap - 1.13.1-2
sssd-proxy - 1.13.1-2
sssd-tools - 1.13.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sssd package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.13.1-2').
